group_1.textCenter: If you don't know what makes a good maid,@it's time to get out there and learn!
I'll lend you a great resource!
(So this is going to be my textbook. Guess @I'll give it a shot.)
(Ah, it starts with the main characters@greeting their master.)

group_1.narration: "I see you're back, Master.@Glad to see you home safely."

group_1.textCenter: (Mm, I think I could imitate this one.)
(Ah, an incident. Are they going to help@investigate?)
(I see. They should turn left here.)
[chara:101601:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Wh-what?! But why?! There is likely a trap@there...

group_1.narration: "Wait. I think there's a trap that way."

group_1.textCenter: See? I thought the same thing.

group_1.narration: "It's a maid's duty to honor and@defend her master's will!"
"A mere trap is nothing before me, @for I am your maid, Master."

group_1.textCenter: So even if she knows she's walking into a@trap, she respects her master's decisions.

group_1.narration: "No. The master is trying@to grow and learn for himself."

group_1.textCenter: Hmm. So in this case, it's more important@that she not intrude.

group_1.narration: "And with this, the case is closed!"

group_1.textCenter: Hm? Why is she moving like that?

group_1.narration: "Just let Maid Mei take care@of all your problems!"

group_1.textRight: Oh, I don't usually catch you like this,@Kanagi. What's that you're reading?

group_1.textLeft: This? It's a reference book I borrowed from@an artist.
It was pretty deep reading. I learned a lot.
